content.raw:
Interesting! I didn't know about that. The main reason to include this code here is because if the user camera is below the surface, you probably won't see anything. It's even worst than that because you'll see a transparent terrain (nothing) and you might thing that there's a problem with the heightmap.

When using <size> is easy to set a valid <gui><camera><pose> because you know the maximum height. When using a DEM file with the true dimensions is more difficult because you probably don't know the elevation.

So, one option is only override the user camera position if there is no <gui><camera><pose> in the world file.
